title: Could an existing vaccine make COVID-19 less deadly? Mexico City study provides support
description: A report supporting the concept of trained immunity for protection from severe COVID-19 was published in Allergy. COVID-19 patients recently vaccinated with the measles-mumps-rubella (MMR) vaccine had a milder infection than expected given their age and health status.

In March 2017, the clinic was renamed and officially established as the Centro de Excelencia en Asma y Alergia Larenas, and now both conducts research and provides advanced care to adults and children with allergic diseases, including asthma. The Center was recertified as a Center of Excellence in 2019 and is located within the office tower of the Hospital Medica Sur, in Mexico City. About Medica Sur [Medica Sur](https://healthtravelmexico.com/eng_index.php#) is a highly specialized health institution made up of medical, diagnostic, research, teaching and social assistance units. Medica Sur brings a select group of professionals from medicine, nursing, administration and hospital operations, who - guided by a strict code of ethics and backed by cutting-edge technologies - aim to offer its patients medical excellence with a human touch. Medica Sur was the first hospital outside the United States to be part of the Mayo Clinic Care Network, thereby promoting collaboration between physicians to improve medical care for all their patients in Mexico. It is certified by the General Health Council of Mexico (Consejo de Salubridad General), validating the quality and safety in the medical care of its patients and families. It has been certified by Trace International for ensuring that its background and policies meet the highest international ethical and anti-bribery standards. It also has the Accreditation of Joint Commission International (JCI), an international, external and independent body that evaluates the quality and safety of health services; Medica Sur has been accredited since 2014. About Parsemus Foundation Parsemus Foundation works to create meaningful improvements in human and animal health and welfare by advancing innovative and neglected medical research, with advances change treatment practice rather than disappearing into the scientific literature.
